Class RepeatingGroupBuilder

java.lang.Object
express.mvp.myra.codec.runtime.struct.RepeatingGroupBuilder
public final class RepeatingGroupBuilder extends Object
A builder for writing repeating groups of fixed-size primitive elements.

Wire Format (Inline Encoding): 

[count:int32][element0][element1]...[elementN-1]

This builder writes elements directly to a pre-allocated memory segment. The count is written first as a placeholder, then elements are appended, and finally the count is updated with the actual number of elements written.

Thread Safety: This class is NOT thread-safe.

Example Usage: 

RepeatingGroupBuilder builder = new RepeatingGroupBuilder(8); // 8 bytes per long
builder.wrap(segment, offset);
builder.addLong(100L);
builder.addLong(200L);
builder.addLong(300L);
int bytesWritten = builder.finish(); // Writes count=3 and returns total bytes

  • Field Details

    • COUNT_SIZE

      public static final int COUNT_SIZE
      Size in bytes of the count field (int32).
      See Also:
      • Constant Field Values

  • Constructor Details

    • RepeatingGroupBuilder

      public RepeatingGroupBuilder(int elementSize)
      Creates a new builder for fixed-size elements.
      Parameters:
      elementSize - the size in bytes of each element (e.g., 8 for int64, 4 for int32)
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if elementSize is not positive

  • Method Details

    • wrap

      public void wrap(@NonNull MemorySegment segment, long offset)
      Wraps this builder around a memory segment at the specified offset. Resets the element count to zero.
      Parameters:
      segment - the memory segment to write to
      offset - the offset within the segment where the group starts
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - if segment is null

    • count

      public int count()
      Returns the current element count.
      Returns:
      the number of elements written so far

    • elementSize

      public int elementSize()
      Returns the element size in bytes.
      Returns:
      the size of each element in bytes

    • currentOffset

      public long currentOffset()
      Returns the current write position (next element offset).
      Returns:
      the absolute offset where the next element will be written

    • currentByteSize

      public int currentByteSize()
      Returns the total bytes that will be written when finished (count field + all elements).
      Returns:
      total byte size = COUNT_SIZE + (count * elementSize)

    • addByte

      public RepeatingGroupBuilder addByte(byte value)
      Adds a byte (int8) element.
      Parameters:
      value - the byte value to add
      Returns:
      this builder for chaining

    • finish

      public int finish()
      Finishes writing the repeating group by updating the count field. Must be called after all elements have been added.
      Returns:
      the total number of bytes written (count + elements)

    • reset

      public void reset()
      Resets this builder, releasing the reference to the segment.
